meanings.definition: An enzyme that catalyzes the transfer of an amino group from one molecule to another.
meanings.sent1: The transaminases in our body help move amino groups between molecules.
meanings.sent2: Doctors can measure transaminases levels in the blood to check for liver damage.
meanings.sent3: The transaminases had a party, swapping amino groups like trading cards.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for organization was like that of transaminases, efficiently transferring tasks from one person to another.
meanings.sent5: The classroom demonstration vividly showed how transaminases move amino groups around.

meanings.definition: A type of protein that plays a key role in the process of amino acid metabolism.
meanings.sent1: Transaminases are essential for the breakdown of amino acids in our bodies.
meanings.sent2: Athletes need transaminases to help with the metabolism of proteins for muscle growth.
meanings.sent3: The transaminases were the superheroes of the amino acid world, fighting off villains of imbalance.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to her work was like that of transaminases, tirelessly processing amino acids day in and day out.
meanings.sent5: The textbook illustration made it clear how transaminases are crucial for amino acid metabolism.
